ProgramElementMissionDescription.val: The Joint Air-to-Ground Missile (JAGM) program is an Army-led, Acquisition Category (ACAT) IC Major Defense Acquisition Program (MDAP) with joint interest with the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) and U.S. Navy. The JAGM is the next generation of aviation-launched, fire and forget missiles to replace the HELLFIRE Laser and Longbow radar missiles.  JAGM will be used by joint service aircraft for destruction of high value stationary, moving, and relocatable land and maritime targets from standoff range in day, night, adverse weather, and obscured battlefield conditions.

SummaryExplanation.val:
FY 2018 adjustments reflect Congressional Reduction for Federal Funded Research and Development Centers (FFRDC) ($.024K), limited user test delay ($4.9M), and a SBIR/STTR transfer ($1.163M).
FY 2019 adjustments reflect Congressional Reduction for Federal Funded Research and Development Centers (FFRDC) ($.015K).
FY 2020 $6.534 million funding increase is a result of Captive Air Training Missile (CATM) Development.

ProjectMissionDescription.val: The Joint Air-to-Ground Missile (JAGM) program is an Army-led, Acquisition Category (ACAT) IC Major Defense Acquisition Program (MDAP) with joint interest with the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) and U.S. Navy. The JAGM is the next generation of aviation-launched, fire and forget missiles to replace the HELLFIRE Laser and Longbow radar missiles.  JAGM will be used by joint service aircraft for destruction of high value stationary, moving, and relocatable land and maritime targets from standoff range in day, night, adverse weather, and obscured battlefield conditions.

Title.val: Engineering and Manufacturing Development (EMD) Qualification of JAGM and Apache Integration

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office and Other Government Agencies (OGAs) completed developmental testing and qualification of the JAGM system, integration onto Apache AH-64E aircraft, lethality modeling, simulation, and effectiveness evaluation in support of Milestone (MS) C.

Text.val: The JAGM Product Office and Other Government Agencies (OGAs) will complete developmental and integration Test and Evaluation (T&E), including LUT, live-fire, initial integrated solution Apache AH-64E flight test, using hardware delivered from the prime contractor.  The data will support System Evaluation, Milestone C, and Full Material Release (FMR).

Title.val: Systems Engineering and MS C Preparation

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs completed all documentation, conducted evaluations, reviews and analyses to support a FY 2018 MS C decision.

Text.val: The program will complete document development, government testing and systems engineering in support of a MS C decision, per DoD 5000.02 and AR 70-1 guidance.

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will confirm that JAGM is producible, as well as operable, safe, and logistically supportable.

Text.val: The JAGM Product will develop all FRP and FMR documentation, conduct review and perform analyses, and conduct government testing to support a FRP decision.
The JAGM Product Office will conduct government testing and Full Materiel Release (FMR) documentation to support a FRP decision.
The JAGM Product Office will complete government testing and FMR documentation to support a FRP decision.

AppChangeSummary.val: Funding decrease from FY 2019 to FY 2020 due to completion of FMR documentation efforts.

Title.val: Post MS C Developmental, Integrated, and Operational Testing

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will demonstrate JAGM Operational Suitability and Effectiveness with AH-64E.

Text.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will conduct Live Fire T&E, verify AH-64 software integration with JAGM Pilot Vehicle Interface (PVI) through captive carry and JAGM flight tests, regression flight tests, environmental and ground launch tests for Safety Release and Airworthiness Release, and Apache-launched flight tests in preparation for IOT&E, FRP decision review, and to support other platform integration.

The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will complete Live Fire T&E, verify AH-64 software integration with JAGM through captive carry and JAGM flight tests, regression flight tests, environmental and ground launch tests for Safety Release and Airworthiness Release, and Apache-launched flight tests in preparation for IOT&E, and support other platform integration. Data will also support FRP decision review and FMR.

AppChangeSummary.val: Funding decrease from FY 2019 to FY 2020 due to the completion of Initial Operational Test and Evaluation (IOT&E).

Title.val: Apache AH-64E and JAGM Software Integration

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office will continue to work JAGM capability on E-model Apaches.

Text.val: The Apache Project Office, by way of Boeing Company, will complete and provide Pilot-Vehicle interface (PVI) capability that is required for seamless JAGM integration on the Apache platform.

AppChangeSummary.val: Funding decrease from FY 2019 to FY 2020 due to the completion of Apache AH-64E and JAGM Software Integration.

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will continue objective platform review, analysis, and threat management.  The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will perform technical assessments, concept studies, prepare documentation, and perform risk reduction efforts.

Text.val: The JAGM Product Office will manage and mitigate risk against emerging threats and conduct review and analysis of objective platforms.

The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will conduct government software testing as well as review and analysis of objective Army platforms.  Software testing includes risk mitigation against emerging threats.  The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will perform technical assessments, concept studies, prepare documentation, and perform risk reduction efforts.

AppChangeSummary.val: Funding increase from FY 2019 to FY 2020 due to risk mitigation against emerging threats and analysis of objective platforms.

Description.val: The CATM is used for captive flight training and for qualification of aircrews to employ tactical missiles in combat.  The JAGM Product Office will develop an inert missile configuration that will meet training needs.

Text.val: The JAGM Product Office and prime contractor will initiate JAGM CATM development.  The prime contractor will develop CATM hardware and software.

AppChangeSummary.val: Funding Increase from FY 2019 to FY 2020 due to initial CATM development.

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will conduct development testing and qualification of the JAGM CATM; achieve air worthiness on threshold platforms.

Text.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will begin Test and Evaluation and develop documentation for Air Worthiness Release.  Test and Evaluation will verify AH-64E Software Integration through captive carry and environmental testing.

AppChangeSummary.val: Funding increase from FY 2019 to FY 2020 due to initial CATM testing.

Description.val: The JAGM prime contractor will conduct qualification of the production line and deliver missiles to support Developmental and Limited User Testing (LUT). The prime contractor will support government-led activities to qualify the JAGM on the AH-64 Apache.

Text.val: The JAGM prime contractor conducted qualification of the production line and deliver missiles to support Developmental and Limited User Testing (LUT). The prime contractor supported government-led activities to qualify the JAGM on the AH-64 Apache.

AcquisitionStrategy.val: The JAGM EMD acquisition approach outlined the plan to complete developmental testing to qualify the All Up Round (AUR) and the contractor production line, and to integrate JAGM on the U.S. Army AH-64E Apache.  Advance Procurement of long lead items (HELLFIRE Romeo back-ends and Guidance Section subsystems) occurred in FY 2016 - FY 2017.  The long lead procurement was needed to facilitate Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) I which was necessary to achieve Initial Operational Capability (IOC) and LRIP II.  MS C was approved on 15 Jun 2018 and Initial Operational Test and Evaluation (IOT&E) is scheduled for the 3rd quarter of FY 2019.

Remarks.val:
(C / FFP) - Competitive/Firm Fixed Price 
(C / CPFF) - Competitive/Cost-Plus Fixed Fee
(C / LH) - Competitive/Labor Hour
(SS / FFP) - Sole Source/Firm Fixed Price
(C / FPIF) - Competitive/Fixed Price Incentive (Firm Target)
